pullRequest.title: Feature/task 540 rest endpoint for repo management
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added web resource class with REST API for project configurations
Created a controller to handle these requests
Refactored RepositoryConfiguration (added empty constructor and equals method)
Refactored tests

Closes #540

commit.message: Added REST method stub for getting all repositories (Task #540)
Try using HTTP post methods with parameters - (Task #540)

Added test case for repo management controller - (Task #540)

---
Task #540: Add REST Endpoint for Management of Repositories

Added a test case for project management rest API (Task #540)

Also clearing RepoRegistry in other tests.
[skip ci]

Minor restructuring for project management rest API (Task #540)

[skip ci]

Added REST API test for project management (Task #540)

- Changed getAllProjects to return a list of project names
- Added equals method to RepositoryConfiguration

Tests for REST API for project management (Task #540)

closes #540

Simplified some code for setting up repository configs - (Task #540)


---
Task #540: Add REST Endpoint for Management of Repositories

nodes.bodyText: Is it ok to access the RepoRegistry in the Resources or should we move this code into the Controller? E.g. have a function getAllProjects() in the Controller?
Also move this RepoRegistry in the Controller?
Codecoverage seems to be complaining about complete lack of coverage of hashCode() and also partially of equals()
Is it ok that we catch the exception here but then return Response.Status.OK in the calling method?

commit.message: Moved RepoRegistry interaction from resource to controller (Task #540)
Return bad request on invalid URI (Task #540)

nodes.bodyText: Would it make sense to move this into the RepositoryConfiguration class and make it public there since the data here purely operates on the configuration?

Maybe we can move this logic into the RepositoryController.
Then we would have all the real decision logic inside the controller, and only the calls and error handling on the resource level.

commit.message:
Created isValid in RepositoryConfiguration (Task #540)

Refactored RepositoryConfigurationTest

nodes.bodyText: Any reason why we cant use the getAllProjectNames().contains(...) anymore instead of RepoRegistry.getInstance().getRepositories().containsKey(...) ?
